clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess Effectiveness of Giving Combination of Standard Chemotherapy Drugs Versus Combination of Standard Chemotherapy and New Drug Ixabepilone When Given Before Surgical Removal of Early Stage Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Phase II Biomarker Neoadjuvant Study of Sequential AC Followed by Ixabepilone Compared to Sequential AC Followed by Paclitaxel in Women With Early Stage Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The study will evaluate the effectiveness of ixabepilone when given after doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide (AC) compared to standard treatment of paclitaxel given after doxorubicin plus cyclophosphamide in patients with early stage breast cancer. In addition the study will verify predefined biomarkers as well as discover new biomarkers that could identify patients who are more likely to respond to ixabepilone than standard paclitaxel based therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Pathologic Complete Response (pCR)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at surgery (performed 4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy)
primary_outcome.description: The pCR was defined as no histologic evidence of residual invasive adenocarcinoma in the breast and axillary lymph nodes, with or without the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) in the breast.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) in Biomarker-Defined Populations
primary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
primary_outcome.description: Beta III tubulin positivity determined by cross-validation method. Optimal cutoff: ≥46% tumor cells staining at 2 plus or 3 plus intensity (corresponding Beta III tubulin positivity=39.4%). Pre-specified cutoff of Beta III tubulin positivity: ≥50% 2plus or 3plus cells (corresponding prevalence=38.5%). Optimal cutoffs for TACC3 and CAPG positivity determined by cross-validation method: 6.889 and 6.844 [log2 normalized intensity units], respectively (corresponding to prevalence rates of 43.3% and 44.3%).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) in 20- and 26-Gene Model Subgroups
primary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
primary_outcome.description: For each of the 2 biomarker sets (20-gene or 26-gene), a multi-gene model was built using penalized logistic regression on all pharmacogenomic evaluable subjects for each treatment arm separately. Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) plots for separate arm using 5 fold cross validation were generated. ROC for separate arms using cross over were also added. Further analysis on the multiple gene models (as mentioned in the SAP) was planned only based on the initial findings from the 2 ROC plots. For 20- and 26-gene models, ROC curves generated for each study arm did not indicate that these multi-gene models differentially predicted for pCR between the treatment arms, so further analyses to estimate the optimal cut-off and the pCR rates were not conducted.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Clinical Objective Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after the last dose of either ixabepilone or paclitaxel (at 12 weeks) but before surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical response was defined as the number of participants who achieved modified World Health Organization's tumor response criteria of clinical complete response (complete disappearance of all clinically palpable detectable malignant disease and/or disappearance of radiological evidence of tumor in the breast and ipsilateral axillary lymph nodes) or clinical partial response (clinical evidence of a reduction in total tumor size of >= 50% in the overall sum of the products of diameters of breast and axillary lesions), divided by the number of randomized participants in that arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Requiring Breast Conservation Surgery
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at surgery (performed 4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of randomized participants requiring breast conservation surgery following study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Combined pCR and Minimal Residual Cancer Burden (RCB) 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at surgery (performed 4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy)
secondary_outcome.description: Combined pCR and RCB-1 was defined as participants with no histologic evidence of residual invasive adenocarcinoma in the breast and axillary lymph nodes, with or without the presence of DCIS in the breast plus subjects with RCB-1 following the RCB calculation based on data entered by the investigator sites in each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Randomized Participants With Non-missing pCR & Biomarker Expression (GENE [Probe Set]), to Explore Whether Gene Expression Patterns for GTSE1, Isoforms of β-tubulin, Kallikreins 5, 6, 10 Are Differentially Predictive of pCR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (performed 4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Relevance of biomarker in differentiation between ixabepilone & paclitaxel evaluated by logistic regression with pCR as response. Statistical analyses include: 1) the likelihood ratio test between the full model (PCR~Biomarker:Treatment:estrogen receptor [ER]) & reduced model (PCR~Treatment:ER); 2) the likelihood ratio test between the full model (PCR~Biomarker:Treatment) & reduced model (PCR~Biomarker+Treatment); 3) the contrast of the interaction between treatment & biomarker expression within ER Negative subjects from the full model(PCR~Biomarker:Treatment:ER). A:B represents A,B & A*B.

secondary_outcome.measure: Randomized Participants With Non-missing pCR & Biomarker Expression (GENE [Probe Set]) to Explore Whether Gene Expression Patterns for GTSE1, Isoforms of β-tubulin, Kallikreins 5, 6, 10 Are Differentially Predictive of pCR/RCB1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Relevance of biomarker in differentiation between ixabepilone & paclitaxel evaluated by logistic regression with pCR/RCB1 as response. Statistical analyses include: 1) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment: ER) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Treatment:ER); 2) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1 Biomarker:Treatment) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker+Treatment); 3) contrast of the interaction between treatment & biomarker expression within ER Negative subjects from the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment:ER). A:B represents A,B & A*B.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With pCR and MDR1 Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Positivity Using Two Pre-Specified Thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: : pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with pCR in MDR1 IHC positive and negative groups using 2 pre-specified thresholds,. The first pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem) =Any membrane staining. The second pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem+Cyto)=Any membrane staining or at least 200 Cytoplasmic H-score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With pCR/RCB1 and MDR1 Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Positivity Using Two Pre-specified Thresholds
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with pCR/RCB1 in MDR1 IHC positive and negative groups using 2 pre-specified thresholds,. The first pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem) =Any membrane staining. The second pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem+Cyto)=Any membrane staining or at least 200 Cytoplasmic H-score .

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With pCR and MDR1 Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Positivity Using Two Pre-specified Thresholds, Estrogen-Receptor (ER) Negative Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of ER negative participants with pCR and MDR1 immunohistochemistry (IHC) positivity using 2 pre-specified thresholds, stratified by biomarker status. The first pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem)=Any membrane staining. The second pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem+Cyto)=Any membrane staining or at least 200 Cytoplasmic H-score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of Biomarker Based on Optimal Threshold (Biomarker Positive Participants)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy and mRNA samples obtained prior to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of participants having the following optimal biomarker thresholds as computed from the cross-validation method (cutoff of biomarker positive [with 90% confidence interval by Bootstrap method]): Beta 3 Tubulin IHC (45.866 [5, 83.9]); TACC3 mRNA (6.714 [6.312, 7.192]); CAPG mRNA (6.739 [5.728, 7.298]). Optimal thresholds for a 20-gene model and a 26-gene model were also planned; however, these were not determined because preliminary analyses did not indicate that they would not differentiate pCR rates between treatment arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Safety Summary: Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Drug-Related AEs, and Most Common Treatment-Related Non-Hematologic Adverse Events (TNAEs) Occuring in >=10% of Participants
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to the first study treatment, at the beginning of each subsequent cycle, weekly during the treatment period and a minimum of 4 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of study therapy
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event. By Worst Common Terminology Criteria of Adverse Events (CTCAE Version 3) Grades

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity of Any Drug-Related AEs and Gastrointestinal AEs by System Organ Class
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to the first study treatment, at the beginning of each subsequent cycle, weekly during the treatment period and a minimum of 4 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of study therapy
secondary_outcome.description: MCT=musculoskeletal and connective tissue, GDASC=general disorders and administration site conditions, RTM=respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders, NBMUCP=neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (including cysts and polyps). Drug related adverse events are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable, possible or missing. Subjects may have more than one event within a class. Graded by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0. (1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death)

secondary_outcome.measure: On-Study Hematology: Worst Common Terminology Criteria of Adverse Events (CTCAE Version 3) Grade Per Participant in Ixabepilone/Paclitaxel Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: prior to the first study treatment, at the beginning of each subsequent cycle, weekly during the treatment period and a minimum of 4 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of study therapy during ixabepilone or paclitaxel treatment phase
secondary_outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. Graded by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0. (1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death)

secondary_outcome.description: Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT), Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST). AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Histologically confirmed primary invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast , T2-3, N0-3, M0, with tumor size of ≥ 2 cm
- All patients with early stage breast adenocarcinoma may enroll irrespective of receptor status
- No prior treatment for breast cancer excluding therapy for DCIS
- Karnofsky performance status of 80 - 100
- left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) ≥ 50% by echocardiogram or multiple gated acquisition (MUGA)
- Adequate hematologic, hepatic and renal function
Exclusion Criteria
- women of child-bearing potential (WOCBP) unwilling or unable to use an acceptable method to avoid pregnancy during and up to 8 weeks after the last dose of the investigational drug
- Women who are pregnant or breastfeeding
- Inflammatory or metastatic breast cancer
- Unfit for breast and/or axillary surgery
- Evidence of baseline sensory or motor neuropathy
- Significant history of cardiovascular disease, serious intercurrent illness or infections including known human immu immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
- History of prior anthracycline therapy Allergies to any study medication or Cremophor® EL

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 384 participants were enrolled in this study; 71 did not receive any study medication.

measure.description: Classifies patients according to their functional impairment. Scores range from 0-100, the lower the score, the worse the survival for most serious illnesses.

outcome.title: Randomized Participants With Non-missing pCR & Biomarker Expression (GENE [Probe Set]) to Explore Whether Gene Expression Patterns for GTSE1, Isoforms of β-tubulin, Kallikreins 5, 6, 10 Are Differentially Predictive of pCR/RCB1
outcome.description: Relevance of biomarker in differentiation between ixabepilone & paclitaxel evaluated by logistic regression with pCR/RCB1 as response. Statistical analyses include: 1) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment: ER) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Treatment:ER); 2) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1 Biomarker:Treatment) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker+Treatment); 3) contrast of the interaction between treatment & biomarker expression within ER Negative subjects from the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment:ER). A:B represents A,B & A*B.
outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.

measure.title: Randomized Participants With Non-missing pCR & Biomarker Expression (GENE [Probe Set]) to Explore Whether Gene Expression Patterns for GTSE1, Isoforms of β-tubulin, Kallikreins 5, 6, 10 Are Differentially Predictive of pCR/RCB1
measure.description: Relevance of biomarker in differentiation between ixabepilone & paclitaxel evaluated by logistic regression with pCR/RCB1 as response. Statistical analyses include: 1) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment: ER) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Treatment:ER); 2) likelihood ratio test between the full model (pCR/RCB1 Biomarker:Treatment) & reduced model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker+Treatment); 3) contrast of the interaction between treatment & biomarker expression within ER Negative subjects from the full model (pCR/RCB1~Biomarker:Treatment:ER). A:B represents A,B & A*B.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With pCR and MDR1 Immunohistochemistry (IHC) Positivity Using Two Pre-Specified Thresholds
outcome.description: Percentage of participants with pCR in MDR1 IHC positive and negative groups using 2 pre-specified thresholds,. The first pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem) =Any membrane staining. The second pre-specified threshold for MDR1-positivity (Mem+Cyto)=Any membrane staining or at least 200 Cytoplasmic H-score.
outcome.time_frame: : pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
outcome.population: Randomized participants with non-missing pCR and biomarker expression

group.description: ixabepilone 40 mg/m^2 administered intravenously (IV) over 3 hours, every 3 weeks for 4 cycles (12 weeks)

group.title: Paclitaxel
group.description: paclitaxel 80 mg/m^2 administered IV every week for 12 weeks

outcome.title: Prevalence of Biomarker Based on Optimal Threshold (Biomarker Positive Participants)
outcome.description: Percentage of participants having the following optimal biomarker thresholds as computed from the cross-validation method (cutoff of biomarker positive [with 90% confidence interval by Bootstrap method]): Beta 3 Tubulin IHC (45.866 [5, 83.9]); TACC3 mRNA (6.714 [6.312, 7.192]); CAPG mRNA (6.739 [5.728, 7.298]). Optimal thresholds for a 20-gene model and a 26-gene model were also planned; however, these were not determined because preliminary analyses did not indicate that they would not differentiate pCR rates between treatment arm.
outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy and mRNA samples obtained prior to treatment
outcome.population: Randomized participants with non-missing pCR and biomarker expressions. n=the number of participants with specific biomarker expression.

group.title: Randomized Participants
group.description: Randomized Participants with non-missing pCR and biomarker expression

measure.title: Prevalence of Biomarker Based on Optimal Threshold (Biomarker Positive Participants)
measure.description: Percentage of participants having the following optimal biomarker thresholds as computed from the cross-validation method (cutoff of biomarker positive [with 90% confidence interval by Bootstrap method]): Beta 3 Tubulin IHC (45.866 [5, 83.9]); TACC3 mRNA (6.714 [6.312, 7.192]); CAPG mRNA (6.739 [5.728, 7.298]). Optimal thresholds for a 20-gene model and a 26-gene model were also planned; however, these were not determined because preliminary analyses did not indicate that they would not differentiate pCR rates between treatment arm.
measure.population: Randomized participants with non-missing pCR and biomarker expressions. n=the number of participants with specific biomarker expression.

outcome.title: Overall Safety Summary: Deaths, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Discontinuations Due to Adverse Events (AEs), Drug-Related AEs, and Most Common Treatment-Related Non-Hematologic Adverse Events (TNAEs) Occuring in >=10% of Participants
outcome.description: AE=any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition in a subject administered an investigational product and that does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE=any untoward medical occurrence that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs inpatient hospitalization (including elective surgery), results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, or is an important medical event. By Worst Common Terminology Criteria of Adverse Events (CTCAE Version 3) Grades
outcome.time_frame: prior to the first study treatment, at the beginning of each subsequent cycle, weekly during the treatment period and a minimum of 4 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of study therapy

outcome.title: Severity of Any Drug-Related AEs and Gastrointestinal AEs by System Organ Class
outcome.description: MCT=musculoskeletal and connective tissue, GDASC=general disorders and administration site conditions, RTM=respiratory, thoracic and mediastinal disorders, NBMUCP=neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (including cysts and polyps). Drug related adverse events are those events with relationship to study therapy of certain, probable, possible or missing. Subjects may have more than one event within a class. Graded by National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0. (1=Mild, 2=Moderate, 3=Severe, 4=Life-threatening/disabling, 5=Death)
outcome.time_frame: prior to the first study treatment, at the beginning of each subsequent cycle, weekly during the treatment period and a minimum of 4 weeks after the last dose of 12 weeks of study therapy

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) in Biomarker-Defined Populations
outcome.description: Beta III tubulin positivity determined by cross-validation method. Optimal cutoff: ≥46% tumor cells staining at 2 plus or 3 plus intensity (corresponding Beta III tubulin positivity=39.4%). Pre-specified cutoff of Beta III tubulin positivity: ≥50% 2plus or 3plus cells (corresponding prevalence=38.5%). Optimal cutoffs for TACC3 and CAPG positivity determined by cross-validation method: 6.889 and 6.844 [log2 normalized intensity units], respectively (corresponding to prevalence rates of 43.3% and 44.3%).
outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
outcome.population: For all subgroups other than Beta-III positive/negative subgroup based on a pre-determined cutoff, results were estimated using a cross-validation method (a resampling based technique, making individual sample size [N] not applicable).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Pathologic Complete Response (pCR) in 20- and 26-Gene Model Subgroups
outcome.description: For each of the 2 biomarker sets (20-gene or 26-gene), a multi-gene model was built using penalized logistic regression on all pharmacogenomic evaluable subjects for each treatment arm separately. Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) plots for separate arm using 5 fold cross validation were generated. ROC for separate arms using cross over were also added. Further analysis on the multiple gene models (as mentioned in the SAP) was planned only based on the initial findings from the 2 ROC plots. For 20- and 26-gene models, ROC curves generated for each study arm did not indicate that these multi-gene models differentially predicted for pCR between the treatment arms, so further analyses to estimate the optimal cut-off and the pCR rates were not conducted.
outcome.time_frame: pCR evaluated at time of surgery (4-6 weeks after the last dose of therapy); mandatory tumor tissue biopsy obtained prior to treatment.
outcome.population: For 20- and 26-gene models, ROC curves generated for each study arm did not indicate that these multi-gene models differentially predicted for pCR between the treatment arms, so further analyses to estimate the optimal cut-off and the pCR rates were not conducted.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co. agreements with investigators vary; constant is our right to embargo communications regarding trial results prior to public release for a period ≤60 days from submittal for review. We will not prohibit investigators from publishing, but will prohibit the disclosure of previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results, and request postponement of single-center publications until after disclosure of the clinical trial's primary publication.
